medical_history.chief_complaint: Vision loss in the right eye, acute progressive vision loss in the left eye, headaches, and rashes.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Four years prior to admission, a brown, nonpainful, nonpruritic, maculopapular rash developed on the trunk, resolving spontaneously in 4 weeks. Painful, peeling, erythematous papules appeared on the hands and web spaces between fingers, with subsequent oral and nasal aphthous ulcerations. The oral ulcers waxed and waned over the following weeks.  Three and a half years prior, bilateral temporal pingueculae were identified, followed by conjunctival ulcerations, headaches, and blurry vision. Symptoms worsened over time leading to decreased vision and new rashes just before admission.
medical_history.past_medical_history: 20-year history of asthma with multiple hospitalizations, spontaneous pneumothoraxes in her 20s, gastroesophageal reflux disease, breast fibroadenoma and fibrocystic changes, hypertension, meibomian gland dysfunction, aqueous tear deficiency, and prior LASIK surgery.
medical_history.family_history: Father had Crohn’s disease, mother had glaucoma and breast cancer, one sister had Hashimoto’s thyroiditis, and another sister had endometrial cancer.
medical_history.social_history: Patient taught at an academic institution, briefly smoked as a teenager, drank wine weekly, did not use illicit drugs, lived with her boyfriend, traveled recently to Nevada (dust storm exposure) and had a history of travel to Shanghai.
